      37                 :            : // This header is logically internal, but is made public because it is used
      38                 :            : // from protocol-compiler-generated code, which may reside in other components.
      39                 :            : 
      40                 :            : #ifndef GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_LITE_H__
      41                 :            : #define GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_LITE_H__

      48                 :            : 
      49                 :            : // Avoid conflict with iOS where <ConditionalMacros.h> #defines TYPE_BOOL.
      50                 :            : //
      51                 :            : // If some one needs the macro TYPE_BOOL in a file that includes this header, it's
      52                 :            : // possible to bring it back using push/pop_macro as follows.
      53                 :            : //
      54                 :            : // #pragma push_macro("TYPE_BOOL")
      55                 :            : // #include this header and/or all headers that need the macro to be undefined.
      56                 :            : // #pragma pop_macro("TYPE_BOOL")
      57                 :            : #undef TYPE_BOOL
      58                 :            : 
      59                 :            : namespace google {
      60                 :            : 
      61                 :            : namespace protobuf {
      62                 :            :   template <typename T> class RepeatedField;  // repeated_field.h
      63                 :            : }
      64                 :            : 
      65                 :            : namespace protobuf {
      66                 :            : namespace internal {
      67                 :            : 
      68                 :            : class StringPieceField;
      69                 :            : 
      70                 :            : // This class is for internal use by the protocol buffer library and by
      71                 :            : // protocol-complier-generated message classes.  It must not be called
      72                 :            : // directly by clients.
      73                 :            : //
      74                 :            : // This class contains helpers for implementing the binary protocol buffer
      75                 :            : // wire format without the need for reflection. Use WireFormat when using
      76                 :            : // reflection.
      77                 :            : //
      78                 :            : // This class is really a namespace that contains only static methods.
      79                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT WireFormatLite {
      80                 :            :  public:
      81                 :            : 
      82                 :            :   // -----------------------------------------------------------------
      83                 :            :   // Helper constants and functions related to the format.  These are
      84                 :            :   // mostly meant for internal and generated code to use.
      85                 :            : 
      86                 :            :   // The wire format is composed of a sequence of tag/value pairs, each
      87                 :            :   // of which contains the value of one field (or one element of a repeated
      88                 :            :   // field).  Each tag is encoded as a varint.  The lower bits of the tag
      89                 :            :   // identify its wire type, which specifies the format of the data to follow.
      90                 :            :   // The rest of the bits contain the field number.  Each type of field (as
      91                 :            :   // declared by FieldDescriptor::Type, in descriptor.h) maps to one of
      92                 :            :   // these wire types.  Immediately following each tag is the field's value,
      93                 :            :   // encoded in the format specified by the wire type.  Because the tag
      94                 :            :   // identifies the encoding of this data, it is possible to skip
      95                 :            :   // unrecognized fields for forwards compatibility.
      96                 :            : 
      97                 :            :   enum WireType {
      98                 :            :     WIRETYPE_VARINT           = 0,
      99                 :            :     WIRETYPE_FIXED64          = 1,
     100                 :            :     WIRETYPE_LENGTH_DELIMITED = 2,
     101                 :            :     WIRETYPE_START_GROUP      = 3,
     102                 :            :     WIRETYPE_END_GROUP        = 4,
     103                 :            :     WIRETYPE_FIXED32          = 5,
     104                 :            :   };
     105                 :            : 
     106                 :            :   // Lite alternative to FieldDescriptor::Type.  Must be kept in sync.
     107                 :            :   enum FieldType {
     108                 :            :     TYPE_DOUBLE         = 1,
     109                 :            :     TYPE_FLOAT          = 2,
     110                 :            :     TYPE_INT64          = 3,
     111                 :            :     TYPE_UINT64         = 4,
     112                 :            :     TYPE_INT32          = 5,
     113                 :            :     TYPE_FIXED64        = 6,
     114                 :            :     TYPE_FIXED32        = 7,
     115                 :            :     TYPE_BOOL           = 8,
     116                 :            :     TYPE_STRING         = 9,
     117                 :            :     TYPE_GROUP          = 10,
     118                 :            :     TYPE_MESSAGE        = 11,
     119                 :            :     TYPE_BYTES          = 12,
     120                 :            :     TYPE_UINT32         = 13,
     121                 :            :     TYPE_ENUM           = 14,
     122                 :            :     TYPE_SFIXED32       = 15,
     123                 :            :     TYPE_SFIXED64       = 16,
     124                 :            :     TYPE_SINT32         = 17,
     125                 :            :     TYPE_SINT64         = 18,
     126                 :            :     MAX_FIELD_TYPE      = 18,
     127                 :            :   };
     128                 :            : 
     129                 :            :   // Lite alternative to FieldDescriptor::CppType.  Must be kept in sync.
     130                 :            :   enum CppType {
     131                 :            :     CPPTYPE_INT32       = 1,
     132                 :            :     CPPTYPE_INT64       = 2,
     133                 :            :     CPPTYPE_UINT32      = 3,
     134                 :            :     CPPTYPE_UINT64      = 4,
     135                 :            :     CPPTYPE_DOUBLE      = 5,
     136                 :            :     CPPTYPE_FLOAT       = 6,
     137                 :            :     CPPTYPE_BOOL        = 7,
     138                 :            :     CPPTYPE_ENUM        = 8,
     139                 :            :     CPPTYPE_STRING      = 9,
     140                 :            :     CPPTYPE_MESSAGE     = 10,
     141                 :            :     MAX_CPPTYPE         = 10,
     142                 :            :   };
     143                 :            : 
     144                 :            :   // Helper method to get the CppType for a particular Type.
     145                 :            :   static CppType FieldTypeToCppType(FieldType type);
     146                 :            : 
     147                 :            :   // Given a FieldSescriptor::Type return its WireType
     148                 :            :   static inline WireFormatLite::WireType WireTypeForFieldType(
     149                 :            :       WireFormatLite::FieldType type) {
     150                 :            :     return kWireTypeForFieldType[type];
     151                 :            :   }
     152                 :            : 
     153                 :            :   // Number of bits in a tag which identify the wire type.
     154                 :            :   static const int kTagTypeBits = 3;
     155                 :            :   // Mask for those bits.
     156                 :            :   static const uint32 kTagTypeMask = (1 << kTagTypeBits) - 1;
     157                 :            : 
     158                 :            :   // Helper functions for encoding and decoding tags.  (Inlined below and in
     159                 :            :   // _inl.h)
     160                 :            :   //
     161                 :            :   // This is different from MakeTag(field->number(), field->type()) in the case
     162                 :            :   // of packed repeated fields.
     163                 :            :   static uint32 MakeTag(int field_number, WireType type);
     164                 :            :   static WireType GetTagWireType(uint32 tag);
     165                 :            :   static int GetTagFieldNumber(uint32 tag);
     166                 :            : 
     167                 :            :   // Compute the byte size of a tag.  For groups, this includes both the start
     168                 :            :   // and end tags.
     169                 :            :   static inline size_t TagSize(int field_number,
     170                 :            :                                WireFormatLite::FieldType type);
     171                 :            : 
     172                 :            :   // Skips a field value with the given tag.  The input should start
     173                 :            :   // positioned immediately after the tag.  Skipped values are simply discarded,
     174                 :            :   // not recorded anywhere.  See WireFormat::SkipField() for a version that
     175                 :            :   // records to an UnknownFieldSet.
     176                 :            :   static bool SkipField(io::CodedInputStream* input, uint32 tag);
     177                 :            : 
     178                 :            :   // Skips a field value with the given tag.  The input should start
     179                 :            :   // positioned immediately after the tag. Skipped values are recorded to a
     180                 :            :   // CodedOutputStream.
     181                 :            :   static bool SkipField(io::CodedInputStream* input, uint32 tag,
     182                 :            :                         io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     183                 :            : 
     184                 :            :   // Reads and ignores a message from the input.  Skipped values are simply
     185                 :            :   // discarded, not recorded anywhere.  See WireFormat::SkipMessage() for a
     186                 :            :   // version that records to an UnknownFieldSet.
     187                 :            :   static bool SkipMessage(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     188                 :            : 
     189                 :            :   // Reads and ignores a message from the input.  Skipped values are recorded
     190                 :            :   // to a CodedOutputStream.
     191                 :            :   static bool SkipMessage(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     192                 :            :                           io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     193                 :            : 
     194                 :            : // This macro does the same thing as WireFormatLite::MakeTag(), but the
     195                 :            : // result is usable as a compile-time constant, which makes it usable
     196                 :            : // as a switch case or a template input.  WireFormatLite::MakeTag() is more
     197                 :            : // type-safe, though, so prefer it if possible.
     198                 :            : #define GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_MAKE_TAG(FIELD_NUMBER, TYPE)                  \
     199                 :            :   static_cast<uint32>(                                                   \
     200                 :            :     ((FIELD_NUMBER) << ::google::protobuf::internal::WireFormatLite::kTagTypeBits) \
     201                 :            :       | (TYPE))
     202                 :            : 
     203                 :            :   // These are the tags for the old MessageSet format, which was defined as:
     204                 :            :   //   message MessageSet {
     205                 :            :   //     repeated group Item = 1 {
     206                 :            :   //       required int32 type_id = 2;
     207                 :            :   //       required string message = 3;
     208                 :            :   //     }
     209                 :            :   //   }
     210                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetItemNumber = 1;
     211                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetTypeIdNumber = 2;
     212                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetMessageNumber = 3;
     213                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetItemStartTag =
     214                 :            :     GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_MAKE_TAG(kMessageSetItemNumber,
     215                 :            :                                 WireFormatLite::WIRETYPE_START_GROUP);
     216                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetItemEndTag =
     217                 :            :     GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_MAKE_TAG(kMessageSetItemNumber,
     218                 :            :                                 WireFormatLite::WIRETYPE_END_GROUP);
     219                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetTypeIdTag =
     220                 :            :     GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_MAKE_TAG(kMessageSetTypeIdNumber,
     221                 :            :                                 WireFormatLite::WIRETYPE_VARINT);
     222                 :            :   static const int kMessageSetMessageTag =
     223                 :            :     GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_MAKE_TAG(kMessageSetMessageNumber,
     224                 :            :                                 WireFormatLite::WIRETYPE_LENGTH_DELIMITED);
     225                 :            : 
     226                 :            :   // Byte size of all tags of a MessageSet::Item combined.
     227                 :            :   static const size_t kMessageSetItemTagsSize;
     228                 :            : 
     229                 :            :   // Helper functions for converting between floats/doubles and IEEE-754
     230                 :            :   // uint32s/uint64s so that they can be written.  (Assumes your platform
     231                 :            :   // uses IEEE-754 floats.)
     232                 :            :   static uint32 EncodeFloat(float value);
     233                 :            :   static float DecodeFloat(uint32 value);
     234                 :            :   static uint64 EncodeDouble(double value);
     235                 :            :   static double DecodeDouble(uint64 value);
     236                 :            : 
     237                 :            :   // Helper functions for mapping signed integers to unsigned integers in
     238                 :            :   // such a way that numbers with small magnitudes will encode to smaller
     239                 :            :   // varints.  If you simply static_cast a negative number to an unsigned
     240                 :            :   // number and varint-encode it, it will always take 10 bytes, defeating
     241                 :            :   // the purpose of varint.  So, for the "sint32" and "sint64" field types,
     242                 :            :   // we ZigZag-encode the values.
     243                 :            :   static uint32 ZigZagEncode32(int32 n);
     244                 :            :   static int32  ZigZagDecode32(uint32 n);
     245                 :            :   static uint64 ZigZagEncode64(int64 n);
     246                 :            :   static int64  ZigZagDecode64(uint64 n);
     247                 :            : 
     248                 :            :   // =================================================================
     249                 :            :   // Methods for reading/writing individual field.  The implementations
     250                 :            :   // of these methods are defined in wire_format_lite_inl.h; you must #include
     251                 :            :   // that file to use these.
     252                 :            : 
     253                 :            : #ifdef NDEBUG
     254                 :            : #define INL GOOGLE_ATTRIBUTE_ALWAYS_INLINE
     255                 :            : #else
     256                 :            : // Avoid excessive inlining in non-optimized builds. Without other optimizations
     257                 :            : // the inlining is not going to provide benefits anyway and the huge resulting
     258                 :            : // functions, especially in the proto-generated serialization functions, produce
     259                 :            : // stack frames so large that many tests run into stack overflows (b/32192897).
     260                 :            : #define INL
     261                 :            : #endif
     262                 :            : 
     263                 :            :   // Read fields, not including tags.  The assumption is that you already
     264                 :            :   // read the tag to determine what field to read.
     265                 :            : 
     266                 :            :   // For primitive fields, we just use a templatized routine parameterized by
     267                 :            :   // the represented type and the FieldType. These are specialized with the
     268                 :            :   // appropriate definition for each declared type.
     269                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType>
     270                 :            :   INL static bool ReadPrimitive(io::CodedInputStream* input, CType* value);
     271                 :            : 
     272                 :            :   // Reads repeated primitive values, with optimizations for repeats.
     273                 :            :   // tag_size and tag should both be compile-time constants provided by the
     274                 :            :   // protocol compiler.
     275                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType>
     276                 :            :   INL static bool ReadRepeatedPrimitive(int tag_size, uint32 tag,
     277                 :            :                                         io::CodedInputStream* input,
     278                 :            :                                         RepeatedField<CType>* value);
     279                 :            : 
     280                 :            :   // Identical to ReadRepeatedPrimitive, except will not inline the
     281                 :            :   // implementation.
     282                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType>
     283                 :            :   static bool ReadRepeatedPrimitiveNoInline(int tag_size, uint32 tag,
     284                 :            :                                             io::CodedInputStream* input,
     285                 :            :                                             RepeatedField<CType>* value);
     286                 :            : 
     287                 :            :   // Reads a primitive value directly from the provided buffer. It returns a
     288                 :            :   // pointer past the segment of data that was read.
     289                 :            :   //
     290                 :            :   // This is only implemented for the types with fixed wire size, e.g.
     291                 :            :   // float, double, and the (s)fixed* types.
     292                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType> INL
     293                 :            :   static const uint8* ReadPrimitiveFromArray(const uint8* buffer, CType* value);
     294                 :            : 
     295                 :            :   // Reads a primitive packed field.
     296                 :            :   //
     297                 :            :   // This is only implemented for packable types.
     298                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType>
     299                 :            :   INL static bool ReadPackedPrimitive(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     300                 :            :                                       RepeatedField<CType>* value);
     301                 :            : 
     302                 :            :   // Identical to ReadPackedPrimitive, except will not inline the
     303                 :            :   // implementation.
     304                 :            :   template <typename CType, enum FieldType DeclaredType>
     305                 :            :   static bool ReadPackedPrimitiveNoInline(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     306                 :            :                                           RepeatedField<CType>* value);
     307                 :            : 
     308                 :            :   // Read a packed enum field. If the is_valid function is not NULL, values for
     309                 :            :   // which is_valid(value) returns false are silently dropped.
     310                 :            :   static bool ReadPackedEnumNoInline(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     311                 :            :                                      bool (*is_valid)(int),
     312                 :            :                                      RepeatedField<int>* values);
     313                 :            : 
     314                 :            :   // Read a packed enum field. If the is_valid function is not NULL, values for
     315                 :            :   // which is_valid(value) returns false are appended to unknown_fields_stream.
     316                 :            :   static bool ReadPackedEnumPreserveUnknowns(
     317                 :            :       io::CodedInputStream* input, int field_number, bool (*is_valid)(int),
     318                 :            :       io::CodedOutputStream* unknown_fields_stream, RepeatedField<int>* values);
     319                 :            : 
     320                 :            :   // Read a string.  ReadString(..., string* value) requires an existing string.
     321                 :            :   static inline bool ReadString(io::CodedInputStream* input, string* value);
     322                 :            :   // ReadString(..., string** p) is internal-only, and should only be called
     323                 :            :   // from generated code. It starts by setting *p to "new string"
     324                 :            :   // if *p == &GetEmptyStringAlreadyInited().  It then invokes
     325                 :            :   // ReadString(io::CodedInputStream* input, *p).  This is useful for reducing
     326                 :            :   // code size.
     327                 :            :   static inline bool ReadString(io::CodedInputStream* input, string** p);
     328                 :            :   // Analogous to ReadString().
     329                 :            :   static bool ReadBytes(io::CodedInputStream* input, string* value);
     330                 :            :   static bool ReadBytes(io::CodedInputStream* input, string** p);
     331                 :            : 
     332                 :            : 
     333                 :            :   enum Operation {
     334                 :            :     PARSE = 0,
     335                 :            :     SERIALIZE = 1,
     336                 :            :   };
     337                 :            : 
     338                 :            :   // Returns true if the data is valid UTF-8.
     339                 :            :   static bool VerifyUtf8String(const char* data, int size,
     340                 :            :                                Operation op,
     341                 :            :                                const char* field_name);
     342                 :            : 
     343                 :            :   static inline bool ReadGroup(int field_number, io::CodedInputStream* input,
     344                 :            :                                MessageLite* value);
     345                 :            :   static inline bool ReadMessage(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     346                 :            :                                  MessageLite* value);
     347                 :            : 
     348                 :            :   // Like above, but de-virtualize the call to MergePartialFromCodedStream().
     349                 :            :   // The pointer must point at an instance of MessageType, *not* a subclass (or
     350                 :            :   // the subclass must not override MergePartialFromCodedStream()).
     351                 :            :   template <typename MessageType>
     352                 :            :   static inline bool ReadGroupNoVirtual(int field_number,
     353                 :            :                                         io::CodedInputStream* input,
     354                 :            :                                         MessageType* value);
     355                 :            :   template<typename MessageType>
     356                 :            :   static inline bool ReadMessageNoVirtual(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     357                 :            :                                           MessageType* value);
     358                 :            : 
     359                 :            :   // The same, but do not modify input's recursion depth.  This is useful
     360                 :            :   // when reading a bunch of groups or messages in a loop, because then the
     361                 :            :   // recursion depth can be incremented before the loop and decremented after.
     362                 :            :   template<typename MessageType>
     363                 :            :   static inline bool ReadGroupNoVirtualNoRecursionDepth(
     364                 :            :       int field_number, io::CodedInputStream* input, MessageType* value);
     365                 :            : 
     366                 :            :   template<typename MessageType>
     367                 :            :   static inline bool ReadMessageNoVirtualNoRecursionDepth(
     368                 :            :       io::CodedInputStream* input, MessageType* value);
     369                 :            : 
     370                 :            :   // Write a tag.  The Write*() functions typically include the tag, so
     371                 :            :   // normally there's no need to call this unless using the Write*NoTag()
     372                 :            :   // variants.
     373                 :            :   INL static void WriteTag(int field_number, WireType type,
     374                 :            :                            io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     375                 :            : 
     376                 :            :   // Write fields, without tags.
     377                 :            :   INL static void WriteInt32NoTag(int32 value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     378                 :            :   INL static void WriteInt64NoTag(int64 value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     379                 :            :   INL static void WriteUInt32NoTag(uint32 value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     381                 :            :   INL static void WriteSInt32NoTag(int32 value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     384                 :            :                                     io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     390                 :            :                                      io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     392                 :            :   INL static void WriteDoubleNoTag(double value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     393                 :            :   INL static void WriteBoolNoTag(bool value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     394                 :            :   INL static void WriteEnumNoTag(int value, io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     395                 :            : 
     396                 :            :   // Write array of primitive fields, without tags
     397                 :            :   static void WriteFloatArray(const float* a, int n,
     398                 :            :                               io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     399                 :            :   static void WriteDoubleArray(const double* a, int n,
     400                 :            :                                io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     402                 :            :                                 io::CodedOutputStream* output);

     408                 :            :                                  io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     409                 :            :   static void WriteBoolArray(const bool* a, int n,
     410                 :            :                              io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     411                 :            : 
     412                 :            :   // Write fields, including tags.
     413                 :            :   static void WriteInt32(int field_number, int32 value,
     414                 :            :                          io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     415                 :            :   static void WriteInt64(int field_number, int64 value,
     416                 :            :                          io::CodedOutputStream* output);
     417                 :            :   static void WriteUInt32(int field_number, uint32 value,

     604                 :            :   // Whether to serialize deterministically (e.g., map keys are
     605                 :            :   // sorted) is a property of a CodedOutputStream, and in the process
     606                 :            :   // of serialization, the "ToArray" variants may be invoked.  But they don't
     607                 :            :   // have a CodedOutputStream available, so they get an additional parameter
     608                 :            :   // telling them whether to serialize deterministically.

     658                 :            : 
     659                 :            :   // Compute the byte size of a field.  The XxSize() functions do NOT include
     660                 :            :   // the tag, so you must also call TagSize().  (This is because, for repeated
     661                 :            :   // fields, you should only call TagSize() once and multiply it by the element
     662                 :            :   // count, but you may have to call XxSize() for each individual element.)

     727                 :            : 
     728                 :            : // A class which deals with unknown values.  The default implementation just
     729                 :            : // discards them.  WireFormat defines a subclass which writes to an
     730                 :            : // UnknownFieldSet.  This class is used by ExtensionSet::ParseField(), since
     731                 :            : // ExtensionSet is part of the lite library but UnknownFieldSet is not.
     732                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT FieldSkipper {
     733                 :            :  public:
     734                 :            :   FieldSkipper() {}
     735                 :            :   virtual ~FieldSkipper() {}
     736                 :            : 
     737                 :            :   // Skip a field whose tag has already been consumed.
     738                 :            :   virtual bool SkipField(io::CodedInputStream* input, uint32 tag);
     739                 :            : 
     740                 :            :   // Skip an entire message or group, up to an end-group tag (which is consumed)
     741                 :            :   // or end-of-stream.
     742                 :            :   virtual bool SkipMessage(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     743                 :            : 
     744                 :            :   // Deal with an already-parsed unrecognized enum value.  The default
     745                 :            :   // implementation does nothing, but the UnknownFieldSet-based implementation
     746                 :            :   // saves it as an unknown varint.
     747                 :            :   virtual void SkipUnknownEnum(int field_number, int value);
     748                 :            : };
     749                 :            : 
     750                 :            : // Subclass of FieldSkipper which saves skipped fields to a CodedOutputStream.
     751                 :            : 
     752                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT CodedOutputStreamFieldSkipper : public FieldSkipper {
     753                 :            :  public:
     754                 :            :   explicit CodedOutputStreamFieldSkipper(io::CodedOutputStream* unknown_fields)
     755                 :            :       : unknown_fields_(unknown_fields) {}
     756                 :            :   virtual ~CodedOutputStreamFieldSkipper() {}
     757                 :            : 
     758                 :            :   // implements FieldSkipper -----------------------------------------
     759                 :            :   virtual bool SkipField(io::CodedInputStream* input, uint32 tag);
     760                 :            :   virtual bool SkipMessage(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     761                 :            :   virtual void SkipUnknownEnum(int field_number, int value);
     762                 :            : 
     763                 :            :  protected:
     764                 :            :   io::CodedOutputStream* unknown_fields_;
     765                 :            : };
     766                 :            :

     787                 :            : inline size_t WireFormatLite::TagSize(int field_number,
     788                 :            :                                       WireFormatLite::FieldType type) {
     789                 :            :   size_t result = io::CodedOutputStream::VarintSize32(
     790                 :            :     field_number << kTagTypeBits);

     792                 :            :     // Groups have both a start and an end tag.

     821                 :            : }
     822                 :            : 
     823                 :            : // ZigZag Transform:  Encodes signed integers so that they can be
     824                 :            : // effectively used with varint encoding.
     825                 :            : //
     826                 :            : // varint operates on unsigned integers, encoding smaller numbers into
     827                 :            : // fewer bytes.  If you try to use it on a signed integer, it will treat
     828                 :            : // this number as a very large unsigned integer, which means that even
     829                 :            : // small signed numbers like -1 will take the maximum number of bytes
     830                 :            : // (10) to encode.  ZigZagEncode() maps signed integers to unsigned
     831                 :            : // in such a way that those with a small absolute value will have smaller
     832                 :            : // encoded values, making them appropriate for encoding using varint.
     833                 :            : //
     834                 :            : //       int32 ->     uint32
     835                 :            : // -------------------------
     836                 :            : //           0 ->          0
     837                 :            : //          -1 ->          1
     838                 :            : //           1 ->          2
     839                 :            : //          -2 ->          3
     840                 :            : //         ... ->        ...
     841                 :            : //  2147483647 -> 4294967294
     842                 :            : // -2147483648 -> 4294967295
     843                 :            : //
     844                 :            : //        >> encode >>
     845                 :            : //        << decode <<
     846                 :            : 
     847                 :            : inline uint32 WireFormatLite::ZigZagEncode32(int32 n) {
     848                 :            :   // Note:  the right-shift must be arithmetic
     849                 :            :   return (static_cast<uint32>(n) << 1) ^ (n >> 31);
     850                 :            : }
     851                 :            : 
     852                 :            : inline int32 WireFormatLite::ZigZagDecode32(uint32 n) {
     853                 :            :   return (n >> 1) ^ -static_cast<int32>(n & 1);
     854                 :            : }
     855                 :            : 
     856                 :            : inline uint64 WireFormatLite::ZigZagEncode64(int64 n) {
     857                 :            :   // Note:  the right-shift must be arithmetic
     858                 :            :   return (static_cast<uint64>(n) << 1) ^ (n >> 63);
     859                 :            : }
     860                 :            : 
     861                 :            : inline int64 WireFormatLite::ZigZagDecode64(uint64 n) {
     862                 :            :   return (n >> 1) ^ -static_cast<int64>(n & 1);
     863                 :            : }
     864                 :            : 
     865                 :            : // String is for UTF-8 text only, but, even so, ReadString() can simply
     866                 :            : // call ReadBytes().
     867                 :            : 
     868                 :      84313 : inline bool WireFormatLite::ReadString(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     869                 :            :                                        string* value) {
     870                 :      84313 :   return ReadBytes(input, value);
     871                 :            : }
     872                 :            : 
     873                 :            : inline bool WireFormatLite::ReadString(io::CodedInputStream* input,
     874                 :            :                                        string** p) {
     875                 :            :   return ReadBytes(input, p);
     876                 :            : }
     877                 :            : 
     878                 :            : }  // namespace internal
     879                 :            : }  // namespace protobuf
     880                 :            : 
     881                 :            : }  // namespace google
     882                 :            : #endif  // GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_WIRE_FORMAT_LITE_H__
